artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Tsutaya Kichizō
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 香蝶楼國貞画 {Kōchōrō Kunisada ga}
text: Left panel of triptych: P.75.51.200 (R), P.75.51.199 (C), P.75.51.198 (L). This triptych represents the "dohyō-iri" or ring-entering ceremony at the beginning of a tournament day. Here, Takaneyama Masaemon apperars as the tachi-mochi, the sword carrier, one of the two attendants of the wrestler who performs the ceremony.
title: Wrestler Takaneyama Masaemon from Higo Province
